metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5265 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Incutio XML-RPC (IXR) Library, as used in WordPress before 3.9.2 and Drupal 6.x before 6.33 and 7.x before 7.31, permits entity declarations without considering recursion during entity expansion, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory and CPU consumption) via a crafted XML document containing a large number of nested entity references, a similar issue to CVE-2003-1564.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.2+dfsg-1').
